column2: truthfully2u, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My Dr. had prescribed Ketorolac to me for tooth pain,until I could get to the Oral Surgeon to remove it. I took it,and it gave me a HORRIBLE migraine. I couldn't take anything else to help it because you are not supposed to mix with any other NSAID's. I was really slowed and didn't want to even move...like I was really doped up,not thr happy kind either.It actually made me in a REALLY bad/angry/irritable mood.After taking it the pain was WORSE. It was a horrible feeling. Not sure what they put in this drug,they said I could only take it for 3 days, but it did not work for me. I am just dealing with the horrible pain until surgery.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I get migraines here and there maybe once or twice a month. They get so severe on my right side of my head that I cannot function. Last year I had Imitrix and it was an awesome medication. The good thing abou it, its cheap but they wont give me anymore. Frustrated as hell...tired of migraines.

column9: I have been a migraine sufferer all my life. I took Torodol oral along with phenergan for my extreme migraines. The Torodol helps with the pain to an extent. The phenergan helps with the assossiated nausea and helps me sleep without waking up every other 10 minutes from the pain. I have had better results for my migraine pain with other meds, but if I feel the onset of a migraine coming, first thing I reach for is my Torodol.

column2: Jeri,  Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been suffering with lower back pain and sciatica for 2 years now.  I had gone to the emergency room and the physician attending prescribed Ketorolac 10 mg, until I could see a specialist.  I have rarely taken it, but when I do, it seems to be very effective for me.  I can feel my lower back tightening and I take one to help "unlock" it.  I use this sparingly.  It's a nice "ace up my sleeve" when I get into trouble with my back.  I have to be careful with pain drugs.  My body doesn't like them that well. I have stomach problems also.  This drug works for "short-term" help. I try to do things on my own.

column1: Severe Lower Back Pain from Kidney Stones
column2: reelfast2, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been taking Toradol only as needed for impacted kidney stones for 5 days after Lithotripsy Surgery. I previously found relief only with Hydrocodone which I found to block and or stiffen the colon and bowel which resulted in added complications. Toradol (Ketorolac) did such a great job of managing my associated kidney stone pain without the side effects of, and complications from Hydrocodone pain medication. Toradol did exactly what it was intended for the initial kidney stone pain and as stones pass completely through the system. I did not have any side affects; however I do highly recommend reading the online side affects, because they can be severe.

column2: Stella, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Taken to ER after 6 days treating what I thought was a cold.  Worse was the non-productive cough,constant aching which was not relieved by 600Mg of IBU,fever with lack of sleep.  Diagnosed with influenza.  Dehydrated.  Treatment included IV with  Toradol & steroids.  What a relief!  I dozed off as the pain was relieved for the first time.  I was also given an RX for Toradol which I may take at bedtime or for returning pain every 8 hours. Note: I did have a flu shot.
